Sequence Information.Peptide Name: I14M (N-terminal GSKKPVP deleted, thanatin analog, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (66.67%) toThanatinR: 21%, I=C: 14%.Chemical modification: C-C disulfide bond .Activity: active against Gram+ A. viridans (MIC 1.2-2.5 uM), M. luteus (MIC 5-10 uM), B. megaterium (MIC 10-20 uM), B-subtilis (MIC >40 uM), S-aureus (MIC > 40 uM), P-acidolactici (MIC >40 uM), Gram- E. coli D22 or D31 (MIC 20-40 uM) strain 106 >40 uM, S-typhimurium (MIC >40 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 20-40 uM), E-cloacae (MIC >40 uM), E-carotovora (MIC >40 uM), P-aeruginosa (MIC >40 uM), fungi N. crassa (MIC 20-40 uM), B. cinerea (MIC 10-20 uM), N-haematococca (MIC >40 uM), T-viride (MIC >40 uM), A. brassicola (MIC 5-10 uM), F. culmorum (MIC 20-40 uM), A-pisi (MIC >40 uM), and F-oxysporum (MIC >40 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Fehlbaum P, Bulet P, Chernysh S, Briand JP, Roussel JP, Letellier L, Hetru C, Hoffmann JA. 1996
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1996 Feb 6;93(3):1221-5. doi: 10.1073/pnas.93.3.1221.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Structure-activity analysis of thanatin, a 21-residue inducible insect defense peptide with sequence homology to frog skin antimicrobial peptides.
